ai.summary: ACW Circular Walk 18 is a demanding 30.2 km circular hike in the United Kingdom. The route combines varied terrain and significant distance, making it a challenging day in the countryside.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect a mix of grassy uplands, muddy and rocky trails, forest tracks, and occasional stile crossings. Surfaces can be uneven and weather-dependent; waterproof footwear and careful footing are essential.
ai.safety_notes: This is a long, hard hike that requires good navigation and planning. In an unknown region, carry a current map or GPS, a fully charged phone, and a backup power source. Plan for daylight, weather changes, and ample water and snacks. Tell someone your route and expected finish time. Start early and be prepared to turn back if conditions deteriorate.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good ankle support
Insulating layer and hat/gloves as needed
Map and compass or GPS device
Fully charged phone and portable charger
Headlamp or flashlight with spare batteries
ai.best_seasons: Spring, Summer, and Autumn (roughly March–October) are ideal for this route; winter conditions can be harsh with shorter daylight and more mud and ice.

seo.title: ACW Circular Walk 18 — 30.2 km Hard UK Hike
seo.meta_description: Plan your trek on ACW Circular Walk 18, a 30.2 km hard hike in the United Kingdom. Learn about terrain, safety tips, gear, and the best seasons.
